pr_title: [FLINK-19872][csv] Fix CSV format is unable to parse millisecond for TIME type

timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: I will optimize.
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText: We should still use getInt, because we always use int to represent number of milliseconds of the day in Flink SQL internally. See Javadoc of RowData.
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: Will overflow when supporting nanosecond precision in the future
replies.author: pyscala

replies.bodyText:
That's why we don't support precision > 3 for now.
When the planner supports precision > 3 in the future, we can update csv format to use the higer precision data structure (maybe long or otheres).
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: get it
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText: Why not reuse the testNullableField method?
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: For example, the input is "12:12:12.232", but the precision is 2, then the result should be "12:12:12.23". The existing test named testNullableField  must be modified to meet the needs of this test. But the change affects other test cases. So i add a new test methed named testFieldForTime.
replies.author: pyscala

replies.bodyText:
For such case, I think you can use the test method only validate the deserialization.
testField(
			DataType fieldType,
			String csvValue,
			Object value,
			Consumer<CsvRowDataDeserializationSchema.Builder> deserializationConfig,
			String fieldDelimiter)
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: Sorry for my carelessness, I will optimize it.
replies.author: pyscala

replies.bodyText:
@wuchong
the following code
Row actualRow = (Row) DataFormatConverters.getConverterForDataType(dataType).toExternal(deserializedRow); 
in methed
testField( DataType fieldType, String csvValue, Object value, Consumer<CsvRowDataDeserializationSchema.Builder> deserializationConfig, String fieldDelimiter)
will change TIME(n) (0<=n<=3) to  TIME(0) .Then the test will fail.
I still use testFieldForTime().
replies.author: pyscala

replies.bodyText:
This works in my environment:
		testField(
			TIME(3),
			"12:12:12.232421",
			LocalTime.parse("12:12:12.232"),
			(deserSchema) -> deserSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
			",");
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: fix it
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText: Add more tests for TIME(1), TIME(2).
timeline.author: wuchong
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -109,6 +109,54 @@ public void testSerializeDeserialize() throws Exception {
 			new byte[] {107, 3, 11});
 	}
 
+	@Test
+	public void testSerializeDeserializeForTime() throws Exception {
+		testFieldForTime(
+			TIME(3),
+			"12:12:12.232",
+			"12:12:12.232",
+			(deserSchema) -> deserSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
+			(serSchema) -> serSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
+			",");
+		testFieldForTime(
+			TIME(3),
+			"12:12:12.232421",
+			"12:12:12.232",
+			(deserSchema) -> deserSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
+			(serSchema) -> serSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
+			",");
+		testFieldForTime(
+			TIME(3),
+			"12:12:12.23",
+			"12:12:12.23",
+			(deserSchema) -> deserSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
+			(serSchema) -> serSchema.setNullLiteral("null"),
+			",");
+		testFieldForTime(
+			TIME(0),

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.author: wuchong
wuchong

replies.bodyText: i will clean up
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText: Why not hard code the exception message?
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: fix it
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText: Could you add a comment "this is for rounding off values out of precision"?
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText:
This will not fail. Because it is not TIME(5).
You should add fail(); if you want to verify it should fail.
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: fix it
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.bodyText:
All of these only test the deserialization. We should also add tests for serialization. I think we can use testNullableField for this purpose.
Besides, we can rename method testField(fieldType, csvValue, value, deserializationConfig, fieldDelimiter) to testFieldSerialization to be more specific.
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: rename method  testField(fieldType, csvValue, value, deserializationConfig, fieldDelimiter) to testFieldSerialization ?  or testFieldDeserialization ?
replies.author: pyscala

replies.bodyText: The reason for not using testNullableField  can be seen in our previous dialogue.
replies.author: pyscala

replies.bodyText: Rename to testFieldDeserialization.
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: We only use testNullableField to test conversion without precision loss.
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: pyscala

timeline.message:
[FLINK-19872][csv] Fix CSV format is unable to parse millisecond for TIME type

This closes #13834

[FLINK-19872][csv] Fix CSV format is unable to parse millisecond for TIME type

This closes #13834
